newsitem.title: UK: UK Conservative Heseltine well after heart surgery.
newsitem.headline: UK Conservative Heseltine well after heart surgery.

text.p: Former British deputy prime minister Michael Heseltine on Thursday underwent a successful angioplasty, a procedure to widen the arteries leading to the heart, the Conservative party said.
"He is resting comfortably and hopes to go home in a few days," party chairman Brian Mawhinney said in a brief statement.

Heseltine, 64, was taken to hospital with chest pains after the Conservatives' crushing election defeat last Thursday and immediately ruled himself out of the race to succeed former prime minister John Major, who is stepping down as party leader.

Heseltine, who helped to topple former prime minister Margaret Thatcher in 1990, has been one of the most powerful figures in the Conservative party. He suffered a mild heart attack in 1993 while holidaying in Venice.
